author: Benard Ogembo, James Wakibia and Conor McGlone
description:
This article was developed with the support of Journalismfund Europe. At Nairobi’s Dandora dumpsite, men, women and children scramble over vast mountains of trash — each waste picker hoping to unearth anything they can sell.  Scavenging silently among them, marabou storks — some nearly five feet tall — wage their own daily contest for survival. A […]

The post New Global Market for “Plastic Credits” Threatens Livelihoods at Kenyan Dump appeared first on DeSmog.
title: New Global Market for “Plastic Credits” Threatens Livelihoods at Kenyan Dump

author: Adam Barnett and Sam Bright
description:
Reform UK is offering access to Nigel Farage at its party conference for sums ranging from £25,000 to a quarter of a million pounds. The right-wing populist party is advertising for companies to attend “an intimate champagne breakfast with Nigel Farage” at its two-day conference at the Birmingham NEC next month, according to its commercial brochure. […]

The post Reform Accused of ‘Cash for Access’ Over £250,000 Champagne Breakfast With Nigel Farage appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Reform Accused of ‘Cash for Access’ Over £250,000 Champagne Breakfast With Nigel Farage

author: Rebecca John
description:
This work was supported by a grant from the Fund for Investigative Journalism With international treaty negotiations aimed at addressing the plastic pollution crisis resuming in Switzerland this week, a new document reveals that one of the world’s largest plastic producers, DuPont, acknowledged as early as 1974 that recycling its plastic products was not possible.  This […]

The post ‘Maddening’ Proof Plastics Industry Knew Recycling Was False Solution in 1974, New Document Shows appeared first on DeSmog.
title: ‘Maddening’ Proof Plastics Industry Knew Recycling Was False Solution in 1974, New Document Shows
